DOC.brief_summary: Atopic dermatitis is a common disease. Emollients and Elidel have both shown to be effective to treat this disease. The research question is, whether the effective component (Elidel) is better than the emollient to improve the skin function.
DOC.brief_title: Elidel-Study: Elidel in Patients With Atopic Dermatitis
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 years Atopic dermatitis on both lower arms at least 1% body surface area. Atopic Dermatitis Severity Index (ADSI)Score >= 6 Investigator Global Assessment (IGA)Score >= 2 Systemic therapy with immunosuppressive drugs within the past 24 weeks Phototherapy against atopic dermatitis. Antibiotic therapy against atopic dermatitis. Allergy against Elidel. Pregnancy Nursing Skin cancer
DOC.keyword: Atopic dermatitis on both lower arm.
